name: legalism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the practice of following the law very closely, especially by paying more attention to rules and details than to the intentions behind them: He argued that legalism was an attempt by lawyers to keep politics out of the courtroom. A return to strict legalism is not the way to go.
[ C ] a legal expression, especially one that is difficult for ordinary people to understand: It's a legalism from the 19th century that not even lawyers should use. You have to leave the legalisms behind and learn to talk like a real person again.
